timeline.message: add blacklist for typo.js unsupported dictionaries

timeline.bodyText: If the app had started up with real time turned off, turning it on without restarting the app wouldn't then call loadDictionary() to ensure that Typo.js was loaded.
timeline.author: adamconroy

timeline.bodyText:
I spot checked a few other dictionaries and they seemed ok, these are the ones listed in the bug. Adding more to this list will be easy and the intention is to not have this problem for too long. If we decide to not spend more time working on this issue, which could be reasonable considering all the variables, I'd move this to a more permanent external home.
By removing canRealtimeSpellcheckDict we can easily be pointed to and clear out all of the subsequent cruft that uses it.
timeline.author: adamconroy

timeline.bodyText: Is the dictionary load idempotent? (seems like if it isn't we'd want to make sure it isn't loaded and avoid loading when the pref changes to false)
timeline.author: jmcphers

replies.bodyText: I should probably just rename the function. loadDictionary checks the values of all relevant preferences now before proceeding.
replies.author: adamconroy

timeline.bodyText: There are a number of RStudio themes in the wild which attempt to dark-theme the dialogs. This is not technically supported but this will break them. What do you think about using opacity instead?
timeline.author: jmcphers

replies.bodyText: I'll give it a shot and see if it looks ok. Would be curious to play around with those themes!
replies.author: adamconroy

timeline.bodyText: I think we should avoid committing a pref change here as it's extremely implicit -- prefs should generally only change due to a user gesture that indicates intent since users can now diff their prefs. Would just bailing from the check do the job here?
timeline.author: jmcphers

replies.bodyText: That should be fine. It's a little weird from the code side because the LintManager and other relevant bits will proceed as if real time checking is on but if we always no-op out of the calls I don't see the harm as the user will see the disabled message when they check options and then it will be saved correctly.
replies.author: adamconroy
